Name: Royal Historical Society of Victoria Inc

About.Hours & facilities: Open Mon-Fri 10am-4pm; closed weekends, public holidays, January and between Christmas and New Year. A fee is charged for use of the collection by non-members. General reference assistance available. Copying services for books, journals, original records to A3, photographs, maps and plans. A modest charge is made for research services undertaken by library volunteers.

About.Acquisition focus: Items relating to Victorian and local history and cultural heritage - books, manuscripts, photographs and other images, artefacts. (95% in-house).

About.Major holdings: Individual persons: Personal papers, diaries 1850- (20m); Photographs 1850- (2m). Members RHSV: Personal papers, manuscript publications 1911-(10m). Government Departments: Maps 1845- (1m).

About.Guides: Entries in National Library of Australia Guide to Collections of Manuscripts Relating to Australia.

About.References: Bowe, Maree, Sources of Victoria's Heritage. History Project Inc, 1985.
